answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
In my experience it's been the City Manager who's helped to set those boundaries between Council and staff.  If done well, then the direct interaction is minimized considerably.  On the other hand if the Mayor or other members of Council still come directly to staff, then staff should be informing the City Manager of this and making sure he/she is included in all the conversations.  Another strategy is to make sure any response to questions from one Council member goes to ALL Council members.
